com.company

Class ApplicationGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.company.ApplicationGUI

  • public class ApplicationGUI
extends java.lang.Object
    Makes the user interface for program and handles different events happening in the program such as clicking on an specific button , exiting operations and so on . Consists of 3 main parts which are called panel1 , panel2 and panel3 which are all located in main area panel . Each panel consists of different panels and components . Panel1 is mainly for saving a list of requests or folder of requests . Panel2 is for generating a new request and specifying the body message , header , auth and query for it . Panel3 is designed for viewing the response .

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ApplicationGUI()
      Generates a new interface and gui for program .

      Updates panel 2 every time a request button is clicked to show the saved fields .

    • Constructor Detail

      • ApplicationGUI

        public ApplicationGUI()
        Generates a new interface and gui for program . Makes a new frame for all panels and other components and apply the last modified settings .

    • Method Detail

      • generateMenuBar

        public void generateMenuBar()
        Sets up the menu bar which is located in the north of the base frame . Menu bar is consisted of 3 menus : application , view and help . Each has different menu items and different functionality . All options which are changes in the options menu will be saved and applied after reopening the program .

      • generatePanel1

        public void generatePanel1()
        Generates panel 1 and saves a list of requests or folder of requests . Adds buttons for adding a new request or new folder ; Also adds the name of the program on top of the list .

      • generatePanel2

        public void generatePanel2()
        Generates panel2 which is designed for making a new request . Consists of a part for adding the url , choosing the method and sending the request ; And another part which includes tabs for body message , header , auth and query . Body message has different types too which are included in different tabs .

      • generatePanel3

        public void generatePanel3()
        Generates panel 3 for viewing the response of a request and analysing it . Like panel 2 consists tabs for body message and header ; And body message has 3 different groups . ( raw , preview , JSON ) Consists of a bar on top which shows the status code , status message and data amount.

      • showGUI

        public void showGUI()
        Shows the gui interface and applies the last changed settings .

      • setLastSavedRequests

        public void setLastSavedRequests()
        Shows the last saved request from reqRepositories directory every time the gui interface is running .

      • setLastChangedSettings

        public void setLastChangedSettings()
        This method applies the last modified changes in the interface based on the settings object which this class includes and has serialized . After deserializing it , it access the last settings .

      • setLightTheme

        public void setLightTheme()
        Sets the theme (Components and panels background color )to light theme .

      • setDarkTheme

        public void setDarkTheme()
        Sets the theme (Components and panels background color )to dark theme .

      • updatePanel2

        public void updatePanel2(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> data,
                         java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headersMap,
                         java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> formDataMap,
                         java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> urlencodedMap,
                         java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> queryMap)
        Updates panel 2 every time a request button is clicked to show the saved fields .
        Parameters:
        data - ArrayList of String data fields
        headersMap - HashMap of headers
        formDataMap - HashMap of form data pairs
        urlencodedMap - HashMap of urlencoded pairs
        queryMap - HashMap of query pairs
